parameters.name: X-Task-Diagnostics
parameters.description: List of profilers to use on tasks.

parameters.description: Filter results where artifact_id matches value

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description:
Ordering

* `pulp_id` - Pulp id
* `-pulp_id` - Pulp id (descending)
* `pulp_created` - Pulp created
* `-pulp_created` - Pulp created (descending)
* `pulp_last_updated` - Pulp last updated
* `-pulp_last_updated` - Pulp last updated (descending)
* `pulp_type` - Pulp type
* `-pulp_type` - Pulp type (descending)
* `upstream_id` - Upstream id
* `-upstream_id` - Upstream id (descending)
* `pulp_labels` - Pulp labels
* `-pulp_labels` - Pulp labels (descending)
* `timestamp_of_interest` - Timestamp of interest
* `-timestamp_of_interest` - Timestamp of interest (descending)
* `group_id` - Group id
* `-group_id` - Group id (descending)
* `artifact_id` - Artifact id
* `-artifact_id` - Artifact id (descending)
* `version` - Version
* `-version` - Version (descending)
* `filename` - Filename
* `-filename` - Filename (descending)
* `pk` - Pk
* `-pk` - Pk (descending)

ContentSummaryResponse.description: Serializer for the RepositoryVersion content summary

base_path.description: The base (relative) path component of the published url. Avoid paths that                     overlap with other distribution base paths (e.g. "foo" and "foo/bar")

hidden.description: Whether this distribution should be shown in the content app.

repository.description: The latest RepositoryVersion for this Repository will be served.

remote.description: Remote that can be used to fetch content when using pull-through caching.

Patchedmaven.MavenRemote.description:
A Serializer for MavenRemote.

Add any new fields if defined on MavenRemote.
Similar to the example above, in MavenArtifactSerializer.
Additional validators can be added to the parent validators list

For example::

class Meta:
    validators = platform.RemoteSerializer.Meta.validators + [myValidator1, myValidator2]

name.description: A unique name for this remote.

url.description: The URL of an external content source.

ca_cert.description: A PEM encoded CA certificate used to validate the server certificate presented by the remote server.

client_cert.description: A PEM encoded client certificate used for authentication.

client_key.description: A PEM encoded private key used for authentication.

tls_validation.description: If True, TLS peer validation must be performed.

proxy_username.description: The username to authenticte to the proxy.

proxy_password.description: The password to authenticate to the proxy. Extra leading and trailing whitespace characters are not trimmed.

username.description: The username to be used for authentication when syncing.

password.description: The password to be used for authentication when syncing. Extra leading and trailing whitespace characters are not trimmed.

download_concurrency.description: Total number of simultaneous connections. If not set then the default value will be used.

max_retries.description: Maximum number of retry attempts after a download failure. If not set then the default value (3) will be used.

policy.description:
The policy to use when downloading content.

* `immediate` - When syncing, download all metadata and content now.

total_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.total (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

connect_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.connect (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

sock_connect_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.sock_connect (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

sock_read_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.sock_read (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

rate_limit.description: Limits requests per second for each concurrent downloader

name.description: A unique name for this repository.

retain_repo_versions.description: Retain X versions of the repository. Default is null which retains all versions.

remote.description: An optional remote to use by default when syncing.

PolicyEnum.description: * `immediate` - When syncing, download all metadata and content now.

verify_checksums.description: Will verify that the checksum of all stored files matches what saved in the database. Otherwise only the existence of the files will be checked. Enabled by default

RepositoryAddCachedContent.description: A mixin for validating unknown serializers' fields.

remote.description: A remote to use to identify content that was cached. This will override a remote set on repository.

RepositoryVersionResponse.description:
Base serializer for use with [pulpcore.app.models.Model][]

This ensures that all Serializers provide values for the 'pulp_href` field.

The class provides a default for the ``ref_name`` attribute in the
ModelSerializers's ``Meta`` class. This ensures that the OpenAPI definitions
of plugins are namespaced properly.

pulp_last_updated.description: Timestamp of the last time this resource was updated. Note: for immutable resources - like content, repository versions, and publication - pulp_created and pulp_last_updated dates will be the same.

base_version.description: A repository version whose content was used as the initial set of content for this repository version

content_summary.description: Various count summaries of the content in the version and the HREF to view them.

SetLabel.description: Serializer for synchronously setting a label.

SetLabelResponse.description: Serializer for synchronously setting a label.

UnsetLabel.description: Serializer for synchronously UNsetting a label.

UnsetLabelResponse.description: Serializer for synchronously UNsetting a label.

repository.description: A URI of a repository the new content unit should be associated with.

pulp_labels.description: A dictionary of arbitrary key/value pairs used to describe a specific Content instance.

artifact.description: Artifact file representing the physical content

relative_path.description: Path where the artifact is located relative to distributions base_path

pulp_last_updated.description: Timestamp of the last time this resource was updated. Note: for immutable resources - like content, repository versions, and publication - pulp_created and pulp_last_updated dates will be the same.

pulp_labels.description: A dictionary of arbitrary key/value pairs used to describe a specific Content instance.

artifact.description: Artifact file representing the physical content

group_id.description: Group Id of the artifact's package.

artifact_id.description: Artifact Id of the artifact's package.

base_path.description: The base (relative) path component of the published url. Avoid paths that                     overlap with other distribution base paths (e.g. "foo" and "foo/bar")

hidden.description: Whether this distribution should be shown in the content app.

repository.description: The latest RepositoryVersion for this Repository will be served.

remote.description: Remote that can be used to fetch content when using pull-through caching.

pulp_last_updated.description: Timestamp of the last time this resource was updated. Note: for immutable resources - like content, repository versions, and publication - pulp_created and pulp_last_updated dates will be the same.

base_path.description: The base (relative) path component of the published url. Avoid paths that                     overlap with other distribution base paths (e.g. "foo" and "foo/bar")

base_url.description: The URL for accessing the publication as defined by this distribution.

no_content_change_since.description: Timestamp since when the distributed content served by this distribution has not changed. If equals to `null`, no guarantee is provided about content changes.

hidden.description: Whether this distribution should be shown in the content app.

repository.description: The latest RepositoryVersion for this Repository will be served.

remote.description: Remote that can be used to fetch content when using pull-through caching.

maven.MavenRemote.description:
A Serializer for MavenRemote.

Add any new fields if defined on MavenRemote.
Similar to the example above, in MavenArtifactSerializer.
Additional validators can be added to the parent validators list

For example::

class Meta:
    validators = platform.RemoteSerializer.Meta.validators + [myValidator1, myValidator2]

name.description: A unique name for this remote.

url.description: The URL of an external content source.

ca_cert.description: A PEM encoded CA certificate used to validate the server certificate presented by the remote server.

client_cert.description: A PEM encoded client certificate used for authentication.

client_key.description: A PEM encoded private key used for authentication.

tls_validation.description: If True, TLS peer validation must be performed.

proxy_username.description: The username to authenticte to the proxy.

proxy_password.description: The password to authenticate to the proxy. Extra leading and trailing whitespace characters are not trimmed.

username.description: The username to be used for authentication when syncing.

password.description: The password to be used for authentication when syncing. Extra leading and trailing whitespace characters are not trimmed.

download_concurrency.description: Total number of simultaneous connections. If not set then the default value will be used.

max_retries.description: Maximum number of retry attempts after a download failure. If not set then the default value (3) will be used.

policy.description:
The policy to use when downloading content.

* `immediate` - When syncing, download all metadata and content now.

total_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.total (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

connect_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.connect (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

sock_connect_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.sock_connect (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

sock_read_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.sock_read (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

rate_limit.description: Limits requests per second for each concurrent downloader

maven.MavenRemoteResponse.description:
A Serializer for MavenRemote.

Add any new fields if defined on MavenRemote.
Similar to the example above, in MavenArtifactSerializer.
Additional validators can be added to the parent validators list

For example::

class Meta:
    validators = platform.RemoteSerializer.Meta.validators + [myValidator1, myValidator2]

pulp_last_updated.description: Timestamp of the most recent update of the remote.

name.description: A unique name for this remote.

url.description: The URL of an external content source.

ca_cert.description: A PEM encoded CA certificate used to validate the server certificate presented by the remote server.

client_cert.description: A PEM encoded client certificate used for authentication.

tls_validation.description: If True, TLS peer validation must be performed.

download_concurrency.description: Total number of simultaneous connections. If not set then the default value will be used.

max_retries.description: Maximum number of retry attempts after a download failure. If not set then the default value (3) will be used.

policy.description:
The policy to use when downloading content.

* `immediate` - When syncing, download all metadata and content now.

total_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.total (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

connect_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.connect (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

sock_connect_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.sock_connect (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

sock_read_timeout.description: aiohttp.ClientTimeout.sock_read (q.v.) for download-connections. The default is null, which will cause the default from the aiohttp library to be used.

rate_limit.description: Limits requests per second for each concurrent downloader

name.description: A unique name for this repository.

retain_repo_versions.description: Retain X versions of the repository. Default is null which retains all versions.

remote.description: An optional remote to use by default when syncing.

pulp_last_updated.description: Timestamp of the last time this resource was updated. Note: for immutable resources - like content, repository versions, and publication - pulp_created and pulp_last_updated dates will be the same.

name.description: A unique name for this repository.

retain_repo_versions.description: Retain X versions of the repository. Default is null which retains all versions.

remote.description: An optional remote to use by default when syncing.
